case_vignette: A previously healthy 60-year-old man comes to his physician because of progressively worsening shortness of breath for the past 2 months. He does not experience shortness of breath at rest. He also occasionally has a dry cough. He has not had fever, chills, or night sweats. He has smoked a pack of cigarettes daily for the past 40 years. He drinks a beer daily and occasionally more on weekends. He does not use illicit drugs. He is 183 cm (6 ft 0 in) tall and weighs 66 kg (145 lbs); BMI is 19.7 kg/m2. His temperature is 37°C (98.6°F), pulse is 94/min, respirations are 21/min, and blood pressure is 136/88 mm Hg. Lung auscultation reveals a prolonged expiratory phase and end-expiratory wheezing. Spirometry shows an FEV1:FVC ratio of 62%, an FEV1 of 60% of predicted, and a total lung capacity of 125% of predicted. The diffusion capacity of the lung (DLCO) is decreased.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Cardiovascular System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing shortness of breath that has been getting worse over the last two months, and I also have a dry cough sometimes.
How old are you?
I am 60 years old.
Do you have a history of heart disease or high blood pressure?
I've been healthy before this and haven't had heart disease or high blood pressure.
Do you have a family history of heart disease or any other hereditary conditions?
I apologize, but there's no information about my family's medical history in the details I've been provided.
Are you taking any medications currently?
No, I'm not on any medications right now.
**Final Diagnosis:** Congestive Heart Failure
